column4: vlc and banshee are similarly blank. mplayer works, but it doesn't allow seeking in partially downloaded files, making it much worse than totem for me.
it may be a video card problem
the files are just fine
I haven't had this problem before and I'm guessing it's due to some 64bit hiccup somewhere
since I've previously only used 32bit ubuntu and installed it in lots of different places :/
mm, I'll install it and see if it works okay
otherwise I'll look at common dependencies between totem, vlc, and xine and see if I can blame anything
:| still no video
wat
it's odd to not have video working out of the box. lemme check if any apt upgrades will help...?
if its nvidia based you may need to blacklist the nouveau driver
add the bootoption: nouveau.blacklist=1
okay, lemme see how that goes, thanks
np man. When you get the proprietary driver in you will be ok
hold shift at boot, press E to (e)dit the kernel. Delete quiet splash and add blacklist.nouveau=1 in its place. Enter to continue
hmmm no such luck
if you websearch: black screen boot ubuntu   you will see a link to the ubuntugeek site, explains it well
video screen seems black still with blacklist.nouveau=1 ... and audio still works
blacklist nv too
have you contacted the maintainer?
its a ppa so not an official source. The maintenaner may havd ceased the ppa. I'd contact them
could bind it to:   killall -u $USER
did not know about custom commands. killall seems to make gdm not pop back (yet to add lightdm), but gnome-session-save looks promising
